response: A certain price point is definitely a major factor. Anything over $750 seems lux. Also exclusively. I like items that are somewhat hard to get. For me personally what differentiates a luxury fashion brand are several factors. First and foremost is quality, the durability of an item is dependent on the quality of the item. I always research the materials the item is made out of not only for my personal knowledge but also to know what I am buying, how to care for it, durability, and if I am getting ripped off. I like to make sure that the luxury item I am paying for is actually luxurious and not cheaply made with cheap materials. I also like to make sure that if I am spending a lot of money I want it to be on something that is timeless and can last for my daughters to one day inherit. Another thing that is important to me is customer service, how you are treated at the store and if they have good service. I also like the items to be exclusive and not something everyone can get their hands on. I also like to buy from brands that have a fair return policy in case I don‚Äôt end up liking the item. But the biggest thing after quality has to be customer service. It has happened that I go into a store wanting to buy an item but if I am not treated correctly and nicely by the sales associate I will not buy anything. It also is really frustrating to get a sales associate who doesn‚Äôt know much about the brand.
For me, luxury items are expensive, limited quantities, and items I see in Vogue, editorials, or celebrities

Exclusivity - the item I buy won't be easy to find or for others to find. Quality - the construction will be the finest and made to last a long time. Taste - the item will be one that will be in good taste even if it is avant garde or not yet in fashion. Uniqueness - the item will reflect a certain style or aesthetic that the particular brand is known for and will be in character with the identity of the brand. Splurge - the item will be more expensive than other items and will add a feeling of luxe that will elevate any outfit. Overall brand identity - the brand will carefully curate its messaging so that I will feel proud to be associated with the brand and those that wear it.
Inventiveness - the brand will seek to explore new ideas and styles, and to set the trends years in advance, and will not be content to simply follow the mainstream. Design - the item will be designed to feature thoughtful details and features that are unique and will be useful to or delight the wearer. Experience - the experience of purchasing the item will be a pleasure from start to finish, from stepping into the store, whether to browse or ultimately purchase. There is a feeling that the brand seeks to build a lasting relationship to which the buyer wants to return again and again, not a short term sales transaction.
Quality, exclusivity and timelessness

The differentiating qualities of a luxury fashion brand includes source materials, design, quality of construction, service delivery and client relationship building. Luxury fashion sources the best materials to create the product. These materials have a more pleasing feel and look, longevity and wear better than non-luxury brands. The design aspects of luxury stems from the creative minds at the helm of the various fashion brands. Luxury fashion creates the look while non-luxury follows the look. Quality of construction and fit sets apart luxury fashion from the rest. Luxury items are made with care and it shows from the pattern, fit and finish...just doesn't compare. Finally, service delivery and relationship building is at the core of luxury. The presentation of the final product and treatment of clientele creates an experience. Luxury shopping should be an experience of enjoyment and echo the brands' overall image and be relatable to the client.
